2026 January 09th

Signed by:- Janaki Parvathi (Aadhaar No. XXXX XXXX XXXX) aged 47 years), Husband: Dandu Ravi, Door No. 4/56, Tarimela Village, Singanamala Mandal, Anantapur District. I hereby submit a settlement deed stating that you are my husband and that out of my love and affection for you, I have given you the property as per the Schedule to which I am entitled as a gift without any consideration and have made the said property yours this very day. Therefore, from now on, you and your heirs shall enjoy the said property as per the Schedule with full rights. Neither I nor my other heirs shall have any rights or obligations. I hereby submit a settlement deed stating that I am resigning. Schedule :- Anantapur R.D. The property in the farm of Tarimela village, which has been acquired by my elders and is hereditary and is in my possession, is owned by me. Parvati. 2. Scanned with CamScanner69. Sheet Endorsement. sections.content: The property covered under Gift Settlement Deed No. 69 of 2026, dated 09/Jan/2026, executed by Jaanaki Paarvati in favour of her husband Dandu Ravi, towards the property admeasuring an extent of 170 Sq. Yds, bearing house number 4/56, comprised in survey number 587/5, Assessment No. 1152 (Old) or 196588001031 (New) situated in Tarimela Village & Gram Panchayat, Singanamala Mandal, within the District of Ananthapur registered at sub-registrar office Pamidi is bounded as follows: North by: House of D. Venkaramudu South by: Rastha East by: Donor Remaining Site West by: Rastha
It is noted from the given documents and EC that the schedule property is not part of any active Mortgage or Lease Deed.

Note: It is to be noted that the online EC has been verified using the key parameters, namely the Document Number, Survey Number/House Number of the concerned SRO, as per the Deed. However, cross-verification across multiple SROs has not been carried out due to the AP portal’s requirement of separate passwords for each search parameter, and the OTP-based authentication mechanism makes searches across multiple SROs operationally infeasible.
